intro: Gaya canescens, commonly known as the silky balsa, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is often found in moist, open habitats such as riverbanks and wetlands. Its stems are hollow and can reach significant heights, making it a distinctive feature in its natural environment. The seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread across various regions.
